New Records: Elly De La Cruz became the 3rd player in MLB history to have 100 stolen bases in his first two big league seasons, joining Rickey Henderson and Vince Coleman. He also reached 65 stolen bases in the season, tying the Atlanta Braves and Minnesota Twins, and was one behind the San Francisco Giants. He surpassed Drew Stubbs to become the Reds' leader in strikeouts for the season with 206 strikeouts.
Key Match Events: Elly De La Cruz stole his 65th base of the season and 100th career stolen base during the 4th inning against the Pittsburgh Pirates, setting a new record for the quickest 100 steals in a player's first two big league seasons.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds' shortstop Elly De La Cruz was discussed in terms of his potential to break records and his future with the team, including comparisons to Shohei Ohtani's steal success rate and Eric Davis' performance.
